question.text: The isotope <math><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></math> having a mass 12.014 u undergoes <math><mi>β</mi></math> - decay to <math><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi> </mi><mo>.</mo><mi> </mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi> </mi><mi> </mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></math> has an excited state of the nucleus <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mmultiscripts><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>*</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></mrow></mfenced></math> at 4.041 MeV above its ground state. If <math><mmultiscripts><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi> </mi><mi> </mi></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></math> decays to <math><mmultiscripts><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>*</mi></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mi> </mi></math> the maximum kinetic energy of the <math><mi>β</mi></math> - particle in units of MeV is ( <math><mn>1</mn><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>931.5</mn><mi> </mi><mi>M</mi><mi>e</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo></math> where c is the speed of light in vacuum).

solution.text:
B→512 C612+ e-10+ v-
Mass defect =(12.014 - 12) u
∴ Released energy = 13.041 MeV
Energy used for excitation of C612=4.041 MeV
∴ Energy converted to KE of electron
=13.041-4.041=9 MeV The β particle will have maximum K.E when antineutrino will have minimum K.E i.e 0. Therefore maximum K.E of the β particle is 9 MeV
